description: The Mer Bleue Boardwalk Trail presents a unique opportunity to view a wetland environment.  About 1.2 kilometers of elevated boardwalk extends out into the Mer Bleue Bog with interpretive panels that provide information on this special ecosystem.Trail 53 and 53A form a 6.7 km loop, along the edge of the peatlands, suitable for hiking and skiing.
directions: Take Innes Road east of Ottawa, then south on Anderson Road.  Turn east on Ridge Road.  Two parking locations, P21 and P22, available.
title: Mer Bleue, Boardwalk Trail and Trails 53 and 53A
